result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Blahnik Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Use Different Name [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.47(2)(b).
  • Fail/Maintain Sex Offender Registry [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample unless already provided. 
Comply with Wisconsin sex offender registry requirements.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: of Preliminary Examination
DNA Order & Acknowledgment

9:58 AM Defendant Mark A. Blahnik Jr. in court, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has waived right to counsel; still wants to continue without counsel. State recites agreement. Def. to plead to Ct. 1 and 2. Joint recommendation: Ct. 1 - imp/stayed 6 years prison (3 ic, 3 es), consecutive to any other, 4 years probation, costs, DNA surcharge and sample, comply with sex offender registry program, counseling and assessments as deemed necessary.  Ct. 2 - time served sentence, costs with DNA surcharge. Def. agrees with terms. Waiver of preliminary hearing reviewed. Def. wants to waive P.H. The Court finds Def. has waived P.H., finds probable cause and binds over for filing of Information. Information filed. Def. has received copy, waives reading. Plea questionnaire reviewed. 
Def. pleads to  Ct. 1 - Sex Offender, use different name, repeater, no contest; Ct. 2 - Fail/maintain sex offender registry, repeater, no contest. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. The Court finds that Def. understands and that pleas were freely and voluntarily given. The Court finds there is a factual basis, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1 and Ct. 2. Sentencing remarks by State. Def. has nothing to say. Remarks by the Court. 
The Court will follow agreement, orders
Ct. 1 - imp/stayed 6 years prison (3 years initial confinement, 3 ext. supervision), consecutive to any other sentence already sentenced to, 4 years probation, costs only including $250 DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, comply with Wisconsin sex offender registry requirements, participate in all counseling and assessments as deemed beneficial by agent. 
Ct. 2 - time served sentence, 113 days jail, costs with DNA surcharge. Zero credit on Ct. 1 if revoked.
Voting/firearm rights. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  
Eligible for both earned release and challenge incarceration programs. Post conviction rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

02:42 PM Defendant Mark A. Blahnik in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark A. Blahnik appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.  Waiver of right to atty filed and Court goes over form with def. Court finds waiver of atty right is freely & voluntarily given.  Def. waives time limits for p.h. Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
SPD Status of Counsel Report

03:44 PM Defendant Mark A. Blahnik in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark A. Blahnik appeared by video means. All parties via zoom. Def. would like to represent himself.  Waiver of right form sent over to jail. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:01 PM Defendant Mark A. Blahnik in court, in custody, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark A. Blahnik appeared by video means.  Court reviews history of case.  Def. make contact with PD and is eligible and will continue to wait.  Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/Bond-Refused to Sign

Comply with sex offender register requirements. 
No use of electronic devices that allows internet access.

03:10 PM Defendant Mark A. Blahnik in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark A. Blahnik appeared by video means, via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  Def. is eligible for P.D. State would like court to adopt bond to continue as in the GF case.  Def. heard on bond. Court gives 3 factors for setting bond & orders $5,000 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls @ 3:21 pm.  Kelly Hays appears via zoom.  Def. in custody and appears via zoo.  State is waiting for additional report and request 1 week to get complaint completed. Bond continues. Def. hasn't contacted P.D.
Bail/Bond

Comply with sex offender register requirements. 
No use of electronic devices without approval of probation agent.

4-20-2022/3:46 p.m.

Judge John Rhode/DCR Alicia Livernash

State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Blahnik

State by DA Gebert.  Def. appears in custody from Langlade County Jail.  All parties and reporter by Zoom.  State advises Court of charges.  State recommends $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions:  Comply with sex registry.  No electronics with access to internet.  State asks for an IA on 4-25-22/1:30 p.m.  Response by Def.  Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions:  Comply with sex offender register requirements.  No use of electronic devices without approval of agent.  IA set for 4-25-22/1:30 p.m.  Recess 3:58 p.m.
